court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT
outcome: Petitioner herein stands arrayed as the sole accused in Crime No.450 of 2017 of Vadanappally Police Station for offences punishable under sections 341, 323, 354, 294(b) and 506 of the Indian Penal Cod
full_text: Bes al eG ape 2018/KER/503 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE SUNIL THOMAS FRIDAY, THE 5TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 15TH POUSHA, 1939 CrlL.MC.No. 8498 of 2017 CRIME NO. 450/2017 OF VADANAPPALLY POLICE STATION , TRISSUR PETITIONER(S)/ACCUSED: SHIHAB S/0O.ABDUL RAHIMAN, AGED 36 YEARS, PUTHENPURAYIL HOUSE, EDASSAREY P.O., THALIKULAM, THRISSUR DISTRICT. BY ADV.SRI.ILV.PRAMOD RESPONDENT(S)/RESPONDENTS: 1. STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682031. 2. VANAJA PRADEEP W/O.PRADEEP, AGED 35 YEARS, PATTALI HOUSE, THRIVENI DESOM, THALIKKULAM VILLAGE, VADANAPPALLY, THRISSUR DISTRICT. R2 BY ADV. SRLK.V.SASIDHARAN R BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR:SRI C N PRABHAKARAN THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 05-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Pls lal eG ape Crl.MC.No. 8498 of 2017 0 2018/KER/S03 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE Al A TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO.450/2017 DATED 1-4-2017 OF VADANAPPALLY POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A2 THE AFFIDAVIT SWORN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT DATED 22-11-2017. RESPONDENTS EXHIBITS:NIL True Copy/P A to Judge Blip gael 2018/KER/503 SUNIL THOMAS, J. Crl.M.C.No.8498 of 2017 Dated this the 5" day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioner herein stands arrayed as the sole accused in Crime No.450 of 2017 of Vadanappally Police Station for offences punishable under sections 341, 323, 354, 294(b) and 506 of the Indian Penal Code. 2. It was alleged by the defacto complainant that due to previous enmity, on 31.03.2017 at 4 p.m., while she was returning on her scooter after her employment, petitioner herein wrongfully pushed her down and committed certain acts with the intention of outraging her modesty. Pursuant to the FI statement laid by her, crime was registered and investigation is progressing. In the meanwhile, Crl.M.C is filed by the petitioner contending that the dispute is a purely personal dispute and parties have resolved the dispute with the defacto complainant who is arrayed as the second respondent. 3. Learned counsel for the second respondent invited my attention to Annexure-A2, which is an affidavit affirmed by the second respondent reiterating the settlement. Learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the settlement has been reported to the police and the statement of the defacto complainant recorded. Be 2018/KER/503 Cri.M.C.8498/17 2 4. Having considered the above facts and the nature of allegations which discloses only a personal dispute between the parties and also considering the fact that, there is nothing on record to show that the petitioner herein is involved in any other crime, I am inclined to invoke the jurisdiction under section 482 Cr.P.C to quash the criminal proceedings to meet the ends of justice. In the result, Crl.M.C is allowed. All further proceedings arising from Crime No.450 of 2017 of Vadanappally Police Station will stand quashed. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS Judge Sbna/5/1/18 True Copy / P A to Judge
